['TAPWATER - water that comes out from a faucet is usually readily available in homes and offices.', 'FAST-FOOD - refers to food items like burgers or fries which can be quickly served at restaurants.', 'ELECTRONICS - modern electronics, such as smartphones, are widely accessible today.', "MEDICATION - prescription drugs that can be obtained easily with a doctor's note.", 'BOOKSTORE - a place where books and reading materials are available for purchase or borrowing.', 'PUBLIC TRANSPORT - buses, trains, subways often run on schedules making them readily accessible to commuters.', 'ECO-FRIENDLY PRODUCTS - items like biodegradable bags and solar panels have become more commonplace due to environmental awarenebility.', 'WIFI SERVICE - internet connectivity is now a ubiquitous service available in many areas worldwide.', 'CONVENIENT STORE - retail stores that are open long hours for easy accessibility of daily necessities.', 'RESOURCES ONLINE - information and materials on the internet are typically available to those with web access.', 'STARVATION - severe deficiency in caloric energy intake, leading to substantial weight loss.', 'MALNUTRITION - condition that results from eating a diet in which one or more nutrients are either not enough or are too much, causing health problems.', 'FOOD DESERT - areas where residents have limited access to affordable and nutritious food.', 'HUNGER STRIKE - a method of non-violent protest by fasting.', 'EMPTY PANTRIESTARVATION - no food in the pantry can lead to hunger.', 'FASTING - voluntarily abstaining from some or all food, drink, or both, for a period of time; this can result in feelings of hunger during its course.', 'GASTRIC BUMPS - visible physical signs that may occur with rapid weight loss due to starvation.', 'UNDERFED - receiving less than the required amount of food and nutrients for normal growth and development.', 'DEHYDRATION - a lack of adequate water intake, which often accompanies hunger when inadequately nourished.', "FOOD SHAME - feelings of shame or guilt related to one's eating habits or food choices that can result from societal pressure.", 'ACCESSORIES - additional components added to enhance the functionality of a product.', 'UPGRADES - improvements made to increase performance, efficiency, or add new features.', 'EXTENSIONS - elements that extend capabilities beyond basic requirements.', 'REFINISHMENTS - processes that improve existing models by adding extra functions.', 'ENHANCING FACTORS - those aspects which contribute to the improvement of a system or model.', 'BOOSTERS - supplements added to increase the power, efficiency, or effectiveness of something.', 'EXPANSIONS - additions that broaden the scope or capacity of an existing framework.', 'COMPLEMENTARIES - items that serve as a good match with another product, thereby adding value and utility.', 'AMENDMENTS - modifications made to improve upon an original model by addressing its shortcomings.', 'UPKEEP SERVICES - additional services offered alongside standard maintenance procedures for improved longeveragency.']
